once row 1 k2 k2tog yo p1 yo ssk k3 until last 7 sts k2tog yo p1 yo ssk k2 row 2 k1 yo p to last st yo k1 row 3 k2 k2tog yo k3 yo ssk k1 k2tog until last 7 sts yo k3 yo ssk k2 row 4 k1 yo p to last st yo k1 row 5 k2 k2tog yo k5 yo s2tog-k1-p2sso yo until last 9 sts k5 yo ssk k2 row 6 k1 yo p1 k1 p7 k1 until last 2 sts p1 yo k1 work chart 7 once row 1 k1 ssk p1 k2tog k1 yo k1 twice ssk until the last 4 sts p1 k2tog k1 row 2 k1 yo p1 k1 p7 until the last 3 sts k1 p1 yo k1 row 3-14 repeat row 1-2 approximately 86g used after completing this section bowerbird ©2017 cath ward this pattern is last 5 sts k3 p1 yo k1 row 3 k1 k2tog yo k1 yo p1 yo k1 yo ssk k1 k2tog yo k1 yo until the last 5 sts p1 yo k1 yo ssk k1 row 4 k1 yo p4 k1 p9 until the last 6 sts k1 p4 yo k1 row 5 k1 k2tog yo k1 yo 3 times p1 yo k1 yo 3 times s1-k2tog-psso yo k1 yo 3 times until last 7 sts p1 yo k1 yo 3 times ssk k1 row 6 bind off using the icelandic bind-off which is stretchy and flexible enough for a blocked edge but still neat instructions for the icelandic bind-off https //www interweave com/article/knitting/icelandic-bind-off/ https //www youtube com/watch v=g6-qqh1toik soak block well pinning out the points around the bottom edge then sew in ends and admire bowerbird ©2017 cath ward this pattern is available freely from www ravelry com and is for personal use only v2 1 6 stitch glossary bobble bind off the specified number of stitches k knit k2tog knit 2 stitches together p purl ssk slip 2 stitches knitwise then knit slipped stitches together s1-k2tog-psso slip one stitch knitwise then knit 2 stitches together and pass the slipped stitch over s2tog-k1-p2sso slip 2 stitches together knitwise knit 1 then pass slipped stitches over yo wrap the working yarn over the right needle from front to back counter-clockwise k yo k in 1 knit leaving the stitch on the needle then yarn over and then knit into the same stitch bowerbird ©2017 cath ward this pattern is available freely from www
